New Records: Lionel Messi scored his 107th and 108th international goals, putting him joint-second with Iran legend Ali Daei on the list of top men’s international scorers behind Cristiano Ronaldo’s 130.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi netted two goals in a strong, 90-minute showing.
Lautaro Martinez scored Argentina’s 39th-minute penalty, the first he’s taken for his country.
Messi assisted Martinez for Argentina’s third goal in the 66th minute.
Lisandro Martinez scored an own goal off a Guatemala free kick in the fourth minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni hoped Messi would play the full 90 minutes against Guatemala.
The match against Guatemala was viewed as a trial for several players to solidify their place in the team or in Scaloni’s starting XI.
Post-Match Reflections: Lautaro Martinez thanked Messi for letting him take the penalty, calling it the gesture of a great player.
Messi praised 19-year-old Valentin Carboni, highlighting his development and quality.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina had nearly 75% possession, particularly in the second half.
A pitch invader reached Messi at Commanders Field.
